alert.note: Alert for Gillespie (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 04 at 4:52AM CDT until June 04 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Gillespie County in south central Texas... * Until 800 AM CDT. * At 452 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Doss, Cherry Spring and Harper. This includes the following streams and drainages... Threadgill Creek, Stuckens Branch, Beaver Creek, Pedernales River, Honey Creek, Rocky Creek, Swayback Creek, Crabapple Creek, Dittmar Creek, Moccasin Creek, North Creek, Pecan Creek, Live Oak Creek, Edwards Creek, Spring Creek, Cedar Creek, Middle Creek, Little Creek, Elm Creek, Flag Creek, Onion Creek, Salt Creek, Maverick Spring Branch, Falls Prong, Marschall Creek, Cherry Spring Creek, Bee Cave Creek, Mormon Creek, Brushy Branch and Flores Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
